metadata.Title: CVE-2022-47939 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: An issue was discovered in ksmbd in the Linux kernel 5.15 through 5.19 before 5.19.2. fs/ksmbd/smb2pdu.c has a use-after-free and OOPS for SMB2_TREE_DISCONNECT.

advisory.DiscoveredBy: Arnaud Gatignol, Quentin Minster, Florent Saudel, Guillaume Teissier

notes.Note: sbeattie> needs ksmbd-tools installed to enable the service, which is not installed by default.

criterions.comment: linux-aws: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-azure: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-signed-azure: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-signed-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
